Black bears are native to North America and are found in a variety of habitats including forests, mountains, and wetlands. They prefer temperate climates with plentiful food sources.

Black bears are native to North America and can be found in a variety of climates, from temperate rainforest to arid desert. They are most commonly found in deciduous forests, but can also be found in coniferous forests, tundra, and even mountainous regions.
